alert.note: Alert for Johnson (Wyoming) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued June 16 at 9:47AM MDT by NWS Riverton
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 6 PM MDT THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Urban and small stream flooding caused by several hours of moderate rainfall continues. * WHERE...A portion of north central Wyoming, including the following county, Johnson. This includes creeks and streams around the city of Buffalo, including Clear Creek and Rock Creek. * WHEN...Until 600 PM MDT Friday. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. Creek and stream flows are elevated and over their typical banks in some areas. Ponding of water in urban areas is possible. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 938 AM MDT, emergency management reported that Clear Creek was out of its banks near and downstream of the confluence with Rock Creek. Between 0.5 and 1 inch of rain has fallen over the past 24 hours. Additional rainfall amounts of 0.25 to 0.5 inches are expected over the area through 6 pm MDT. This additional rain may result in additional rises on area creeks and streams. Rainfall is forecast to end by 6 pm MDT. - This includes the following streams and drainages... Sayles Creek, Cummings Creek, Mowry Creek, North Rock Creek, Negro Creek, South Rock Creek, Pheasant Creek, McVenry Draw, Boxelder Creek, Shell Creek, Rock Creek, South Fork Shell Creek, Johnson Creek, Clear Creek, Sand Creek, North Fork Sayles Creek, North Fork Shell Creek, Healy Draw, Bull Creek, Dump Draw and North Prong Shell Creek. - Some locations that may experience flooding include... Buffalo, Rock Creek, Clear Creek.
info.instruction: In hilly terrain there are hundreds of low water crossings which are potentially dangerous in heavy rain. Do not attempt to cross flooded roads. Find an alternate route. Please report observed flooding to local emergency services or law enforcement.
